024/**
025 * The Link object represents a possible design-time link for a response.
026 *
027 * <p>
028 * The Link Object represents a possible design-time link for a response. The presence of a link does not guarantee 
029 * the caller's ability to successfully invoke it, rather it provides a known relationship and traversal mechanism 
030 * between responses and other operations.
031 *
032 * <h5 class='section'>OpenAPI Specification:</h5>
033 * <p>
034 * The Link Object is composed of the following fields:
035 * <ul class='spaced-list'>
036 *    <li><c>operationRef</c> (string) - A relative or absolute reference to an OAS operation (mutually exclusive with <c>operationId</c>)
037 *    <li><c>operationId</c> (string) - The name of an existing, resolvable OAS operation (mutually exclusive with <c>operationRef</c>)
038 *    <li><c>parameters</c> (map of any) - A map representing parameters to pass to an operation as specified with <c>operationId</c> or identified via <c>operationRef</c>
039 *    <li><c>requestBody</c> (any) - A literal value or expression to use as a request body when calling the target operation
040 *    <li><c>description</c> (string) - A description of the link (CommonMark syntax may be used)
041 *    <li><c>server</c> ({@link Server}) - A server object to be used by the target operation
042 * </ul>
043 *
044 * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
045 * <p class='bjava'>
046 *    <jc>// Create a link to another operation</jc>
047 *    Link <jv>link</jv> = <jk>new</jk> Link()
048 *       .setOperationId(<js>"getUserById"</js>)
049 *       .setParameters(
050 *          JsonMap.<jsm>of</jsm>(<js>"userId"</js>, <js>"$response.body#/id"</js>)
051 *       )
052 *       .setDescription(<js>"The id value returned in the response can be used as userId parameter in GET /users/{userId}"</js>);
053 * </p>
054 *
055 * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
056 *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://spec.openapis.org/oas/v3.0.0#link-object">OpenAPI Specification &gt; Link Object</a>
057 *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://swagger.io/docs/specification/links/">OpenAPI Links</a>
058 *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://juneau.apache.org/docs/topics/JuneauBeanOpenApi3">juneau-bean-openapi-v3</a>
059 * </ul>
060 */
061@FluentSetters
062public class Link extends OpenApiElement {
063
064   private String operationRef;
065   private String operationId;
066   private String description;
067   private Object requestBody;
068   private Server server;
069   private Map<String,Object> parameters;
070
071
072   /**
073    * Default constructor.
074    */
075   public Link() {}
076
077   /**
078    * Copy constructor.
079    *
080    * @param copyFrom The object to copy.
081    */
082   public Link(Link copyFrom) {
083      super(copyFrom);
084
085      this.operationRef = copyFrom.operationRef;
086      this.description = copyFrom.description;
087      this.operationId = copyFrom.operationId;
088      this.requestBody = copyFrom.requestBody;
089      this.server = copyFrom.server == null ? null : copyFrom.server.copy();
090      this.parameters = copyOf(copyFrom.parameters);
091   }
092
093   /**
094    * Make a deep copy of this object.
095    *
096    * @return A deep copy of this object.
097    */
098   public Link copy() {
099      return new Link(this);
100   }
101
102   /**
103    * Bean property getter:  <property>operationRef</property>.
104    *
105    * <p>
106    * The identifying name of the contact person/organization.
107    *
108    * @return The property value, or <jk>null</jk> if it is not set.
109    */
110   public String getOperationRef() {
111      return operationRef;
112   }
113
114   /**
115    * Bean property setter:  <property>operationRef</property>.
116    *

122    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk> to unset the property.
123    * @return This object
124    */
125   public Link setOperationRef(String value) {
126      operationRef = value;
127      return this;
128   }
129

132    *

135    *
136    * @return The property value, or <jk>null</jk> if it is not set.
137    */
138   public String getDescription() {
139      return description;
140   }
141
142   /**
143    * Bean property setter:  <property>description</property>.

148    */
149   public Link setDescription(String value) {
150      description = value;
151      return this;
152   }
153
154   /**
155    * Bean property getter:  <property>externalValue</property>.
156    *
157    * <p>
158    * The email address of the contact person/organization.
159    *
160    * @return The property value, or <jk>null</jk> if it is not set.
161    */
162   public String getOperationId() {
163      return operationId;
164   }
165
166   /**
167    * Bean property setter:  <property>externalValue</property>.
168    *
169    * <p>

171    *
172    * @param value
173    *    The new value for this property.
174    *    <br>MUST be in the format of an email address.
175    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk> to unset the property.
176    * @return This object
177    */
178   public Link setOperationId(String value) {
179      operationId = value;
180      return this;
181   }
182
183   /**
184    * Bean property getter:  <property>default</property>.
185    *
186    * <p>
187    * Declares the value of the parameter that the server will use if none is provided, for example a <js>"count"</js>
188    * to control the number of results per page might default to 100 if not supplied by the client in the request.
189    *
190    * (Note: <js>"value"</js> has no meaning for required parameters.)
191    * Unlike JSON Schema this value MUST conform to the defined <code>type</code> for this parameter.
192    *
193    * @return The property value, or <jk>null</jk> if it is not set.
194    */
195   public Object getRequestBody() {
196      return requestBody;
197   }
198
199   /**
200    * Bean property setter:  <property>value</property>.
201    *
202    * <p>
203    * Declares the value of the parameter that the server will use if none is provided, for example a <js>"count"</js>
204    * to control the number of results per page might default to 100 if not supplied by the client in the request.
205    * (Note: <js>"default"</js> has no meaning for required parameters.)
206    * Unlike JSON Schema this value MUST conform to the defined <code>type</code> for this parameter.
207    *
208    * @param val The new value for this property.
209    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk> to unset the property.

213      requestBody = val;
214      return this;
215   }

236      return this;

239   /**

245    * @return The property value, or <jk>null</jk> if it is not set.
246    */
247   public Map<String,Object> getParameters() {
248      return parameters;
249   }
250
251   /**
252    * Bean property setter:  <property>examples</property>.
253    *
254    * <p>
255    * An example of the response message.
256    *
257    * @param value
258    *    The new value for this property.
259    *    <br>Keys must be MIME-type strings.
260    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk> to unset the property.
261    * @return This object
262    */
263   public Link setParameters(Map<String,Object> value) {
264      parameters = copyOf(value);
265      return this;
266   }
267
268   /**
269    * Adds a single value to the <property>examples</property> property.
270    *
271    * @param mimeType The mime-type string.  Must not be <jk>null</jk>.
272    * @param parameter The example.  Must not be <jk>null</jk>.
273    * @return This object
274    */
275   public Link addParameter(String mimeType, Object parameter) {
276      assertArgNotNull("mimeType", mimeType);
277      assertArgNotNull("parameter", parameter);
278      parameters = mapBuilder(parameters).sparse().add(mimeType, parameter).build();
279      return this;
280   }
281
282   // <FluentSetters>
283
284   // </FluentSetters>
285
286   @Override /* OpenApiElement */
287   public <T> T get(String property, Class<T> type) {
288      assertArgNotNull("property", property);
289      return switch (property) {
290         case "description" -> toType(getDescription(), type);
291         case "operationRef" -> toType(getOperationRef(), type);
292         case "operationId" -> toType(getOperationId(), type);
293         case "requestBody" -> toType(getRequestBody(), type);
294         case "parameters" -> toType(getParameters(), type);
295         case "server" -> toType(getServer(), type);
296         default -> super.get(property, type);
297      };
298   }
299
300   @Override /* OpenApiElement */
301   public Link set(String property, Object value) {
302      assertArgNotNull("property", property);
303      return switch (property) {
304         case "description" -> setDescription(Utils.s(value));
305         case "operationId" -> setOperationId(Utils.s(value));
306         case "operationRef" -> setOperationRef(Utils.s(value));
307         case "parameters" -> setParameters(mapBuilder(String.class, Object.class).sparse().addAny(value).build());
308         case "requestBody" -> setRequestBody(value);
309         case "server" -> setServer(toType(value, Server.class));
310         default -> {
311            super.set(property, value);
312            yield this;
313         }
314      };
315   }
316
317   @Override /* OpenApiElement */
318   public Set<String> keySet() {
319      var s = setBuilder(String.class)
320         .addIf(description != null, "description")
321         .addIf(operationId != null, "operationId")
322         .addIf(operationRef != null, "operationRef")
323         .addIf(parameters != null, "parameters")
324         .addIf(requestBody != null, "requestBody")
325         .addIf(server != null, "server")
326         .build();
327      return new MultiSet<>(s, super.keySet());
328   }

334      super.strict();
335      return this;
336   }
337
338   @Override /* GENERATED - do not modify */
339   public Link strict(Object value) {
340      super.strict(value);
341      return this;
342   }
